title: Flexi cap funds are back in favour. But do they really offer the best diversification?
summary: Flexi-cap funds may offer diversification without forcing exposure to expensive market segments. But these are not the only ones that promise diversification across market caps.

title: Stocks to buy for long term: From Bharat Forge, BoB to Bajaj Auto— Nirmal Bang suggests 10 shares for up to 50% returns
summary: Stocks to buy for the long term: According to Nirmal Bang, several stocks, including Bharat Forge, Bank of Baroda, Bajaj Auto, Paytm, and SRF, show strong bullish patterns. Key support levels are outlined, with expectations for upward price movements in the near term.

title: IIP data to FOMC minutes: Top five triggers for Indian stock market this week
summary: Top five stock market triggers next week: India's IIP data, FOMC minutes, Rupee outlook, gold and silver prices and FII Activity are the top five triggers for the Indian stock market.

title: Record IPO boom: Over 700 issues raise  ₹3.8 trillion in two years, young companies lead listings: Report
summary: In 2025, the Indian IPO market thrived with 365 companies raising  ₹1.95 trillion, driven by strong investor interest across sectors. Retail and foreign investors contributed significantly, highlighting a trend toward diversification and increased participation from younger firms.

title: Bitcoin price retraces 30% from record high. How does crypto market look like in 2026?
summary: Bitcoin has fallen roughly 30% from record high levels and is down more than 6% so far this year, as the market continues to find it difficult to recover after the October crash.

title: Infosys vs TCS vs Wipro vs HCL Tech: Which IT stock to buy ahead of Q3FY25 results?
summary: According to Sugandha Sachdeva- Founder-SS WealthStreet, large-cap IT stocks are beginning to show early signs of bottoming out, after a prolonged phase of correction, consolidation, and relative underperformance through most of 2025.

title: S&P 500 vs Nifty 50: Why  ₹1 lakh in US index earned more for Indian investors despite lower 10-year returns? Explained
summary: As per a Vested Finance analysis, the rupee has weakened against the dollar at a steady pace for more than 10 years, losing roughly 3% a year. In 2025 alone, the rupee has lost 6% as it plummeted to a record low of 91. Rupee has recovered some lost ground, but it still hovers around the 89.50 level.

title: 'We are the Lakshmi Mittals of AI industry...': Deepak Shenoy on why Indian investors should not fear missing AI boom
summary: Deepak Shenoy, founder and CEO of Capitalmind thinks AI as a theme is not lost for India. In fact, India's apparent late entry into the AI race may emerge as its strategic advantage.

title: 2025: A defining year that reshaped global trade, policy, and capital markets
summary: 2025 proved a transformative year, marked by the US's assertive 'America First' agenda and escalating global trade tariffs. India responded with significant economic reforms, including tax relief and a GST overhaul, while navigating volatile foreign investment flows. The year concluded with strong GDP growth, low inflation, and supportive monetary policy, positioning India for future resilience.

title: From rail to tech stocks: These 10 smallcap stocks post up to 35% weekly gains
summary: Indian equity markets saw mild profit booking near record highs. However, several smallcap stocks delivered sharp gains this past week. K&R Rail Engineering surged 34.32%. Jupiter Wagons rose 33.60%. Sasken Technologies gained 32.82%. Hindustan Copper and KNR Constructions also saw substantial increases. These stocks bucked the subdued market tone, showcasing strong individual performance.

title: Market outlook: FII trend, monthly expiry among top factors to track this week
summary: Indian markets are poised for a volatile week ahead, influenced by the December F&O expiry and crucial domestic data releases. Foreign institutional investors continue their selling spree, while global cues and currency movements also demand attention. Experts advise a cautious, stock-specific approach with disciplined risk management as the year concludes.

title: Expert view: Broad-based rallies in mid, small-caps like the past cycle unlikely in 2026, says Anand Rathi Chairman
summary: Anand Rathi's Chairman, Pradeep Gupta, shares insights on the Indian stock market, highlighting that 2026 will see earnings-led returns rather than broad-based rallies. He finds domestic cyclicals, such as those linked to capex, manufacturing, and infrastructure, attractive.

title: Gold rate today in India: 22-carat, 24-carat gold price in Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, other cities
summary: Gold rate today in India: Check how much gold costs in different cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Kolkata.

title: MCX silver jumps 40% in December alone, gains  ₹1,53,554 per kg in 8 months; analysts see further upside in 2026
summary: Silver prices have soared 175% in a year, driven by supply shortages and increasing industrial demand. Analysts expect continued gains as investment interest rises. The metal's inclusion in critical minerals lists and weakening dollar support prices.&nbsp;

title: India’s pension reset: Why 2025 was a turning point
summary: Structural changes were made to the NPS to increase its wider acceptance among households, while EPFO took some tough calls to plug complete withdrawals of the provident fund. Here are the headline events of 2025 in the space that you should take note of.
